messages.content: Determine if the following question is self-contained.
A duplicate file finder is an example of a utility. Describe what is meant by a utility
True - the question is self-contained
Determine if the following question is self-contained.

De-Duplicator creates a tree to represent directories and files on the system. It then traverses each directory and file represented in the tree. It does this using a depth-first traversal. State what order it will visit each of the files as shown in Fig.1 below.
False - the question is not self-contained as it requires use of Fig. 1, which is not given
Determine if the following question is self-contained.

Every time the program encounters a file it takes a hash of the file and checks it against a list. If the hash exists in the list, the file is marked to be deleted. If the hash does not exist it is added to the list. (i) Explain two characteristics you would look for in a hashing algorithm for this purpose
True - the question is self-contained
Determine if the following question is self-contained.
After running the program a user finds that they still have apparent duplicates of some of their images. Explain why these apparent duplicates might still be present.
False - the question is not self-contained as details of 'the program' are needed, but are not given.

False - the question is not self-contained as the 'data above' is not given

The company wants users to be able to register with its website. Users will provide details such as their weight, height, any allergies and pre-existing medical conditions. The system will use this information along with the data on their calories burnt to recommend meal plans for the user. Discuss the legal and ethical issues the company needs to consider for such a system
True - the question is self-contained
